description: This course examines the representation of nature from creation narratives of Norse myth, 19th
and up to present concerns about climate change and environmental destruction in the Nordic
central works and contested notions of nature. Alongside these, they will be introduced to
textual analysis. This provides an entryway into the environmental humanities, and an
makes Nordic literature and culture unique. Offered periodically.
fullname: Nature in Nordic Literature and Culture (Taught in English)
